titles.title: Reaffirming the Taiwan Relations Act and the Six Assurances as the cornerstone of United States-Taiwan relations.
Reaffirming the Taiwan Relations Act and the Six Assurances as cornerstones of United States-Taiwan relations.
Reaffirming the Taiwan Relations Act and the Six Assurances as cornerstones of United States-Taiwan relations.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Asia and the Pacific.
Subcommittee on Asia and the Pacific Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported in the Nature of a Substitute (Amended) by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Mr. Royce moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 88.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

term.name: Sovereignty, recognition, national governance and status

bill.summary:
Affirms that the Taiwan Relations Act and the Six Assurances are both cornerstones of U.S.-Taiwan relations.
Urges the President and Department of State to publicly, proactively, and consistently affirm the Six Assurances as a cornerstone of U.S.-Taiwan relations.
